question: Our daughter was a healthy 3 year old who for no reason started gaining weight at an alaming rate. In July of 06 she weighed  40 pounds. In July of 07 she weighed 52 pounds In September of 08 she was up to 76 pounds. We were sent to an endocrinologist in 07, who ran some bloodwork and said that everything was fine that we just had to accept the fact that we had a chunky child and that we needed to stop her from gaining weight.  In September we were sent back to the endocrinologist who again ran some bloodwork and said that her Thyroid levels were abnormal just as they had been in 07.  He also ran in depth test for diabetes and cushings all of which came back negative. However even with a strict diet at home of 1100 calories and daily exercise she continues to gain weight.  Her resting metabolic was tested by a pediatric nutritionest and showed it to be between 1150 and1200.  We have done everything we can to stop the weight gain and all the doctors will tell us is that we need to do more.  her most recent gain was 3 pounds in 16 days.  What can we do?
title: children with abnormal thyroid test results
